analysis.raw_content:
Extracted content from the page:

Title
- Noise-producing equipment site planning

General rules (verbatim bullets on page)
- May not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
- May encroach into street-side yard up to 6' (Fig 27 C below)
- All service equip. must meet the City’s Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code.
- Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section where feasible.
- Must be insulated and housed, however, Planning Dept. can waive this requirement if equipment is located in buildable area and a combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will assure compliance with the City’s Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.

Figure caption
- Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

Figure A — Pool equipment (bullets printed under “A Pool equipment”)
- Pool equip. is within buildable area even though there is room for it behind the garage/poolhouse in the required rear yard.
- Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-the-way niche maintaining the required 10' min. clearance for the driveway

Labels visible in A diagram
- Combo garage / small poolhouse
- Rear yard
- Buildable area
- Main dwelling
- Front yard
- P (pool equipment symbol)
- AC (air conditioning symbol)
- 10' min. clear

Figure B — Pool equipment & AC unit (bullets printed under “B Pool equipment & AC unit”)
- Pool equip. is located within buildable area even though there is room for it next to the poolhouse in the required rear yard.
- Air conditioning equip. is located within buildable area behind the house. There is not enough room along the interior side of the house.

Labels visible in B diagram
- Larger poolhouse
- Rear yard
- Buildable area
- 2-car attached garage
- Main dwelling
- Front yard
- P (pool equipment symbol)
- AC (air conditioning symbol)

Figure C — Generator & AC unit (bullets printed under “C Generator & AC unit”)
- Air conditioning equip. is located in street side yard in compliance with the regulations. Note that it may not encroach into the front or rear yards.
- Generator is located within buildable area.

Labels visible in C diagram
- Garage
- Rear yard
- Buildable area
- Main dwelling
- Front yard
- Street-side yard
- AC (air conditioning symbol) with “6' max.” callout
- G (generator symbol)

Key (legend)
- Curb
- Lot line
- Sidewalk
- Required setbacks
- Buildable area
- Dwelling/parking
- P Pool equip.
- AC Air conditioning equip.
- G Generator

Page number
- 33
